key_insight: StereoPilot replaces brittle multi-stage Depth→Warp→Inpaint pipelines with a unified, generative-prior–driven model that directly synthesizes stereo views, reducing error propagation and handling different stereo formats in one framework.
problem_solved: Automatic monocular-to-stereo conversion suffers from cascading errors, depth ambiguity, and incompatibility between parallel and converged stereo formats; this paper addresses those limitations to produce higher-quality, consistent stereo videos efficiently.
method: Train a single end-to-end model that leverages generative priors to infer plausible complementary views instead of relying on explicit depth estimation and sequential warping/inpainting.
Enforce geometric and stereo-consistency losses and incorporate a lightweight format-adapter to handle both parallel and converged stereo configurations without separate pipelines.
Optimize for efficiency (inference-time and parameter cost) so the method is practical for real-world video and VR/3D content pipelines.
impact: Makes high-quality stereo video generation more reliable and accessible, lowering barriers for 3D content production in VR, cinema, and AR, and providing a robust baseline for future view-synthesis research.
visual_elements: Side-by-side pipeline comparison: classic DWI multi-stage flow vs. StereoPilot unified model (fewer blocks, no error propagation arrows).
Architecture sketch: input monocular frame → generative-prior module → stereo adapter → left/right outputs, with annotations for consistency losses.
Before/after qualitative triplet: monocular input, DWI output (common artifacts), StereoPilot output (improved depth and fewer holes).
Bar chart or scatter plot summarizing improvements: visual quality metrics, artifact reduction, and inference latency (relative comparison).
paper_title: StereoPilot: Learning Unified and Efficient Stereo Conversion via Generative Priors
paper_authors: Guibao Shen, Yihua Du, Wenhang Ge, Jing He, Chirui Chang
